statements: CREATE TABLE remote_learning (id INT PRIMARY KEY, course_name VARCHAR(255), instructor VARCHAR(255), students INT);
CREATE TABLE example_table1 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), age INT);
CREATE TABLE example_table2 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, department VARCHAR(255), manager VARCHAR(255);
CREATE TABLE students (student_id INT PRIMARY KEY, student_name TEXT, course TEXT);
CREATE TABLE courses (course_id INT PRIMARY KEY, course_name TEXT, instructor TEXT);
CREATE TABLE students (student_id INT PRIMARY KEY, student_name STRING, email STRING, age INT)
CREATE TABLE courses (course_id INT PRIMARY KEY, course_name STRING, instructor STRING, description STRING)
CREATE TABLE enrollments (enrollment_id INT PRIMARY KEY, student_id INT REFERENCES students(student_id), course_id INT REFERENCES courses(course_id), enrollment_date DATE)
CREATE TABLE example_table1 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), description VARCHAR(255), status VARCHAR(50);
CREATE TABLE example_table2 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, code VARCHAR(20), details TEXT, amount DECIMAL(10, 2);
CREATE TABLE example_table3 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, start_date DATE, end_date DATE, location VARCHAR(100);
CREATE TABLE Employees (employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_name VARCHAR(255), department VARCHAR(255), position VARCHAR(255);
CREATE TABLE Projects (project_id INT PRIMARY KEY, project_name VARCHAR(255), start_date DATE, end_date DATE);
CREATE TABLE Tasks (task_id INT PRIMARY KEY, project_id INT, task_name VARCHAR(255), assigned_to INT, deadline DATE);
